Playground Cob Murals

The design for this fantasy tree in the playground came from the children’s drawings of their imaginary world that they were led to through story telling. The welcome cob mural (below) surrounds the main school entrance. Both were created with lots of fun by the children.

Click below for full images

“The insect on this tree lives in the magical valley. She eats the nectar from those flowers… You get there through the crystal tunnel.”

  • Where – Ysgol Talyllychau, Talley, Llandeilo
  • Funded by – Ysgol Talyllychau PTA

School Mosaic

A mixed media mural depicting the village of Talley as it was when the school was built in 1874. The mosaics were created from the children’s studies of the local buildings and landmarks that would have existed then.

Click below for full images
  • Where – Ysgol Talyllychau, Talley, Llandeilo
  • Funded by – Ysgol Talyllychau PTA

Earth Oven

The local community created this functional and decorative oven for baking bread and pizzas. It’s made from the earth from the farm, straw, sand and water.

Click below for full images
  • Where – Swansea Community Farm, Cadle, Swansea
  • Funded by – Swansea Community Farm
